author: Cortex XSOAR

automation.description: Collects all results from previous tasks. (Available from Cortex XSOAR 5.0.0.)
automation.name: TroubleshootAggregateResults

automation.description: Gets a Docker image and checks if it exists on the machine running Cortex XSOAR.
automation.name: TroubleshootIsDockerImageExists

automation.description: Click the "Test" button and return if the test failed.
automation.name: TroubleshootTestInstance

automation.description: Exports all certificate-related information from the Python Docker container and decodes it using RFC. It also retrieves the certificate located in the specified endpoint.
automation.name: CertificatesTroubleshoot

automation.description: Gets a command with its arguments, validates the command and the arguments, and then parses it to use in the Cortex XSOAR context.
automation.name: TroubleshootGetCommandandArgs

automation.description: Executes a command in Cortex XSOAR in debug mode and pulls logs from the command execution.
automation.name: TroubleshootExecuteCommand

automation.description: Gets an instance's configuration parameters in order to troubleshoot the instance.
automation.name: TroubleshootGetInstanceParameters

automation.description: Populates the InstanceName field with active instances.
automation.name: TroubleshootInstanceField

incidentfield.description: Pick configuration if you have problem with configuring the integration. Pick command for troubleshooting running a command.
incidentfield.name: Troubleshoot type

incidentfield.description: Name of the instance to troubleshoot
incidentfield.name: Instance Name

incidentfield.description: Will run the command with 'insecure' flag.
incidentfield.name: Run with 'insecure'

incidentfield.description: The aggregated results of the troubleshooting playbook.
incidentfield.name: Troubleshoot Summary

layoutscontainer.description: Use this layout to view the Troubleshooting summary and files.
layoutscontainer.name: Integration Troubleshooting Layout

playbook.description: Troubleshoot a problem with either an integration's configuration or with running a command.
playbook.name: Integration Troubleshooting

description: Use this pack to troubleshoot your environment.
name: Troubleshoot
readme:
This pack contains utilities for troubleshooting your environment. 

When encountering issues, make sure to check out our [Troubleshooting Guide](https://xsoar.pan.dev/docs/reference/articles/troubleshooting-guide).

# Troubleshooting Playbook

---
This playbook is meant for automatic troubleshooting when encountering a problem with configuring an 
instance or running a command.

The playbook will run the command/instance with several tests and will output a summary and a zip file with information
that you can later submit to the [Cortex XSOAR support site](https://support.paloaltonetworks.com)

## How to use 

---
* Configure a [Core REST API integration](https://xsoar.pan.dev/docs/reference/packs/integrations-and-incident-health-check#1-core-rest-api-integration) instance.
* Create a new incident of type "Integration Troubleshooting"
* **Troubleshoot type**:
    * Use ***I'm unable to configure an instance*** if you fail to configure an integration (the test button returns an error). 
    Note you must save this integration even if the test button fails.
    * Use ***I have a problem with running a command*** if you fail to run a particular command.
* **Instance Name**: The name of the instance to troubleshoot.
* **Command Line**: Fill if you used the ***command*** as the **troubleshoot type**. (The command name with all its arguments.)
* Create the incident.
* The playbook will collect the following information:
    * Instance configuration (without sensitive information such as the password or api keys).
    * Logs of running the Test button with several configurations.
    * Logs of executing the command (if you picked ***command*** in **Troubleshoot type**).
* A summary will be posted to the War Room alongside a zip file that will contain all collected information.
* With this information you can submit a bug to the [Cortex XSOAR support site](https://support.paloaltonetworks.com).
